alert.note: Alert for Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 04 at 1:47AM AKST until February 04 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow and periods of light freezing rain expected. Additional snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches. Ice accumulations less than one tenth of an inch. * WHERE...Juneau. * WHEN...Until 6 AM AKST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Wet snow may be difficult to manage. Light freezing rain will cover exposed surfaces with a coating of ice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow and freezing rain are expected to continue through Friday morning mainly North of Lemon Creek. Downtown and Douglas have warmed above freezing and are likely seeing a mix of rain and snow. The airport will likely transition to rain before Mendenhall Valley and further out the road. Confidence is low regarding the exact timing of the transition to rain and the freezing rain potential, which could greatly affect total snowfall amounts. Areas that receive more mixed precipitation and change to rain sooner will likely have lower snowfall amounts.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.

area.areaDesc: Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island
